name: The emperor and the nightingale
description:
The Nightingale (Nattergalen) is a fairy tale by Danish writer and poet Hans Christian Andersen, famous for his children's stories.
As soon as the Emperor of China learned that one of the most beautiful and valued things in his empire was the song of a certain nightingale, he ordered to bring it to the palace so that he too could admire its melody. The nightingale agreed to come to the court, and when it sang before the emperor, he was so impressed that he did not allow the nightingale to return to the forest where it lived. However, some time later the emperor received a gift, a mechanical bird that imitated the sound of the real nightingale, and he lost interest in it and let it go. However, the mechanical bird eventually broke down and the Emperor became deathly ill shortly thereafter. As soon as the real nightingale heard about it, it returned to the palace and sang a beautiful song that restored him to health.
